concept.title: View vs ItemView
concept.shortdesc: A card can have a View and an ItemView.

dlentry.dd: View is a card fully opened.
ItemView is a card rendered as a list item.

conbody.p: This table listed the typical content of View and ItemView for each type of cards.

strow.stentry: Typically a detailed view of token attributes.
The most important information about the token. Take a DeFi token for example, an ItemView might only have balance and status (e.g. health factor in the case of AAVE token).
An at-a-glance view of the activity.
Typically, a form where users can type information.
A preview of such a form. ItemView of an ActionCard is not often used and usually not defined.

section.title: View and ItemView of an Token Card
section.p: Often, for a TokenCard card, an ItemView is used first, and when the user clicks it, he gets to see the full view. It is almost always the case in user's wallet.

fig.title: ItemView and View used in wallet
fig.desc: In AlphaWallet, a user clicks at FIFA ticket token collection and a list of tokens are present through ItemViews. If they clicks the ItemView of a Token, they sees the View of that token.

section.p: However, on a web page, its web developer can design where and whether ItemView or View should be used. In the below example, ItemViews of 2 Tokens (TokenCard) is used for user to choose which token to use for the payment. When the user chooses a Token, what opens is the "Pay" , not the . The View of a TokenCard is unused at all. ItemView used on a website during checkout Web developer can decide whether or not ItemView or View is used on their website, and what happens if the user clicks them.
